Module com.example.batallanaval
Package com.example.batallanaval.model

Interface IBoat

All Known Implementing Classes:
Boat, BoatAdapter
public interface IBoat
Interface that defines the structure and behavior of a boat used in a Battleship-style game. Provides methods for creating, configuring, and interacting with boats on the board.
Version:
1.0
Author:
Juan Esteban Arias, Junior Lasprilla Prada, Steven Fernando Arag√≥n

  • Method Details

    • createSegment

      javafx.scene.Node createSegment(int segmentIndex)
      Creates a visual segment of the boat based on its index.
      Parameters:
      segmentIndex - The index of the boat segment to create.
      Returns:
      A Node representing the visual element of the segment.

    • getSize

      int getSize()
      Returns the size (number of segments) of the boat.
      Returns:
      The size of the boat.

    • getResistance

      int getResistance()
      Returns the current resistance (health) of the boat.
      Returns:
      The boat's remaining resistance.

    • getIsHorizontal

      boolean getIsHorizontal()
      Indicates whether the boat is oriented horizontally.
      Returns:
      true if the boat is horizontal, false if vertical.

    • reduceResistance

      void reduceResistance()
      Decreases the resistance (health) of the boat by one.

    • setPosition

      void setPosition(int row, int col)
      Sets the starting position (row and column) of the boat on the board.
      Parameters:
      row - The row where the boat starts.
      col - The column where the boat starts.

    • getPosition

      int[] getPosition()
      Returns the current position of the boat on the board.
      Returns:
      An array with two elements: [row, col].

    • createAircraftCarrier

      void createAircraftCarrier()
      Configures the boat as an aircraft carrier.

    • createSubmarine

      void createSubmarine()
      Configures the boat as a submarine.

    • createDestructor

      void createDestructor()
      Configures the boat as a destroyer.

    • createFrigate

      void createFrigate()
      Configures the boat as a frigate.

    • rotateTheBoat

      void rotateTheBoat()
      Changes the orientation of the boat (horizontal ‚Üî vertical).

    • getShape

      javafx.scene.Group getShape()
      Returns the visual representation of the entire boat as a JavaFX Group.
      Returns:
      A Group node containing the visual elements of the boat.

    • getType

      String getType()
      Returns the type of the boat (e.g., "Aircraft Carrier", "Submarine", etc.).
      Returns:
      A string representing the boat type.
